    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String address
      Address of the Employee (Can not be empty, according to acceptance criteria).
      private AuthFacade authFacade
      Authentication Facade of the Application.
      private Email email
      E-mail of the Employee (Can not be empty, according to acceptance criteria).
      private java.lang.String employeeID
      Employee ID of the Employee (Generated automatically by the System, according to acceptance criteria).
      private java.lang.String name
      Name of the Employee (Can not be empty, according to acceptance criteria).
      private static int numberOfEmployees
      Number of Employees working for the Company.
      private java.lang.String organizationRole
      Organization role of the Employee (Can not be empty, according to acceptance criteria).
      private java.lang.String password
      Password of the Employee (Generated automatically, should have three capital letters and two digits, according to acceptance criteria).
      private java.lang.String phoneNumber
      Phone Number of the Employee (Is composed by eleven numbers, according to client criteria).
      private java.lang.String socCode
      SOC code of the Employee (Can not be empty and it is always composed by four characters, according to acceptance criteria).

      • Employee

        public Employee​(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                Email email,
                java.lang.String socCode,
                java.lang.String organizationRole,
                java.lang.String address)
        Generates an instance of the class Employee.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Employee.
        phoneNumber - Phone Number of the Employee.
        email - E-mail of the Employee.
        socCode - SOC code of the Employee.
        organizationRole - Organization role of the Employee.
        address - Address of the Employee.

    • Method Detail

      • checkName

        public void checkName​(java.lang.String name)
        Allows the System to confirm if the given Name is correct according to the acceptance criteria. Verifies if the Name is blank/empty. Verifies if the Name has more than thirty five characters.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Employee.

      • checkPhoneNumber

        public void checkPhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Allows the System to confirm if the given Phone Number is correct according to the acceptance criteria. Verifies if the Phone Number is blank/empty. Verifies if the Phone Number does not have eleven digits.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - Phone Number of the Employee.

      • checkSOCCode

        public void checkSOCCode​(java.lang.String socCode)
        Allows the System to confirm if the given SOC Code is correct according to the acceptance criteria. Verifies if the SOC Code is blank/empty. Verifies if the SOC Code does not have four digits.
        Parameters:
        socCode - SOC Code of the Employee.

      • checkOrganizationRole

        public void checkOrganizationRole​(java.lang.String organizationRole)
        Allows the System to confirm if the given Organization Role is correct according to the acceptance criteria. Verifies if the Organization Role is blank/empty. Verifies if the Organization Role exists within the System. Verifies if the Organization Role has more that thirty five characters.
        Parameters:
        organizationRole - Organization Role of the Employee.

      • checkAddress

        public void checkAddress​(java.lang.String address)
        Allows the System to confirm if the given Address is correct according to the acceptance criteria. Verifies if the Address is blank/empty.
        Parameters:
        address - Address of the Employee.

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword()
        Allows the System to register an automatically generated password to the Employee. Uses a method that creates a random password, that contains three capital letters, two digits and five lower case letters.

      • setEmployeeID

        public void setEmployeeID()
        Allows the System to register an automatically generated Employee ID to the Employee. Has according to the acceptance criteria, the System starts by getting the Employee's name initials and generating a five digit number according to the number of employees registered on the Employee Store.

      • getEmployeeNumber

        private java.lang.String getEmployeeNumber()
        Obtains the number of the Employee in the format that it should appear in the Employee ID, according to the acceptance criteria (always 5 numbers). Returns the number of the Employee in the needed format.
        Returns:
        Number of the Employee.

      • registerUserAndSendEmail

        public void registerUserAndSendEmail()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Allows the System to register the Employee to the Authentication Facade of the Application and sends an automatic E-mail to the Employee (containing the information that he needs to use the application). The E-mail will be sent to a File.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Exception to be thrown in case the File is not found.
        java.io.IOException

      • reduceNumberOfEmployees

        public static void reduceNumberOfEmployees()
        Allows the System to reduce the number of registered Employees, if the last Employee did not pass the validation.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Employee otherEmployee)
        Allows to do the comparison between two Employees.
        Parameters:
        otherEmployee - Other Employee to be compared to the Employee.
        Returns:
        Boolean value according to the comparison (true = Employees are equal | false = Employees are not equal).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Allows the System to get a String that contains most of the information relative to the Employee. Information contained in the String: Name, Address, Phone Number, E-mail, Organization Role, Employee ID, SOC Code.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String that contains information of the Employee.
